z1xNLcFOE4yDQhFoZkBtYQ.text: I think I'm in agreement with others reviewing this pub that it's safe to say the staff here are not the most polite of people. Although 'The Albert' is overrun by groups tourists most of the time, the pub takes exception to groups of local workers and casual drinkers and the bar manager tends to hover/police tables of 5+. Quiet drink with one colleague after work? Go ahead and pay The Albert a visit. Want to catch up with a group of friends? Go somewhere else.

uTflY28nVKXBtR0vag3nzA.text: As near to Victoria Station as you can get without it feeling like a train station pub. It's a friendly sight to tourists, but not offensive to locals (though they do make a point of advertising their afternoon tea). Because of it's close proximity to the station and Westminster Cathedral, it iis busy all day every day, and for that reason alone it might not really be worth your bother. But if you find yourself needing to meet someone for a meal or a drink before the speed out of town, youo could definitely do worse.

oJx0q_FSZV25-KpFewAdqw.text: popped in for a lunchtime tipple today, as it is on the tourist trail between Victoria station and Westminster it is absolutely packed with people taking photos of each other rather than enjoying a good ale! If you are here for the day pop in, if not then qype it up and find another gem

Q4dYK2sRS52KRKnaWFdWoA.text: I love (quite fancy) the ambiance of The Albert, charming and cozy, though it may not be as 'happening' as other pubs....nice for dates, family, or business. There were quite a few tourists around maybe due to its location. Hearing so many negative things about fish n chips, I braced myself to try it...turns out it was pretty good, not too greasy and no bone in my fish...though yes it would be boring to have a whole plate by myself. My friend and I also had some kind of lamb stew, as well as a dish of chicken with rice. We thought both were pretty tasty, but seemed more like ethnic food than local fare.The restaurant upstairs and the ground level pub offer a variety of dishes for (relatively) reasonable prices. The restaurant also offers some kind of carved meat buffet for £11.25. And the pub offers afternoon tea all day/night =).

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. raisin scones served with clotted cream + jam
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. fish n chips
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Interior of The Albert's bar area

o3XvCQqih6r9v8CtrNzOiA.text: Great vibe at The Albert! Loved the inside of this place. Their fish and chips was alright - we're American so we found it to be a bit bland, but I'm sure we'd say that about all fish and chips. Overall though, we liked this place and they had a great drink menu. Get there early - it fills up by 5:30 or 6p.

gbxnT7GAM2Bx5QKBT5xBjQ.text: I don't know how you can muddy up fish and chips, but the kitchen has managed to. Fish was rubbery and chips weren't crisp, even the peas were lacking. Cute pub, but eat somewhere else.

Y_-AHLWrVFL4wyv5BUB0IA.text: TOURIST TRAP ALERT! This place looks sooooo cool. I'll admit it, it totally hooked me with its cool windows, it's mom & pop exterior look, it's European allure.HOOKED ME! These cool looking restaurants are located throughout the city (We also ate at The White Swan before we realized the catch) and the decor, location and theme are all so perfect that you can't resist, but then you realize that the menu in each of these restaurants is the same and it's a chain equivalent to Applebee's and then you are all, "DOH! I'm eating at the London version of Sizzler." Restaurant choice fail. Now, it's not that I am totally against the idea of frequenting chains; it's just that I would really rather spend my money at a locally owned small business and I feel that this chain definitely tricks people! With that being said...the traditional London pie with mash and veggies was surprisingly tasty, even if I did have to walk up to the counter to order and then be served buffet style. No table service for food in the downstairs pub area. I cannot speak for the upstairs restaurant as we only ate in the Pub. -2 stars for chain menu trickery. -1 star for self service at table service prices.

ny3Veu4uU9uu7h7likQHzA.text: This is one of my go-to pubs when I visit London. This gem is located in a beautiful old building in the middle of busy Victoria Street. For the location, it's an excellent value - the brews are good, the bartenders are friendly. Table service can be a little spotty but hey, it's a pub.

SQUFWFgPdMU3EYNm8gs_jA.text: The staff is friendly and the place has a cozy feel, but that's about it. Prices are ridiculous given the quality of the food, which is horrid. Everything was undersalted and overgreased. I know this just sounds like the ramblings of an ignorant American tourist not being used to real British food, but trust me, the food really is that bad. Probably why the place was filled with a lot of locals that were only drinking with no food in sight. They have a very limited beer selection as well.

rHEWNiq2ox2SEyZYEZQVzg.text: You can't miss the Albert on this part of Victoria Street: as a building, it really is a survivor, hemmed in by towering glass and steel on all sides. From the outside, it is a classic, large, Victorian pub. The interior is impressive, too: high ceilings, elaborate decoration, with lots of polished wood and etched glass. And it serves a decent selection of real ales, too. It's what every package tourist thinks an English pub should be. That, as you may have guessed, is its problem. It's a favourite of tourist coach parties and, after they've arrived, service can be a very slow and tedious affair. Staff can be friendly, but too often they just look bored. It's pricier than other venues in the area too. Worth a pint, maybe, to see the interior, but I'd suggest the nearby Buckingham Arms or Cask & Glass if you want an enjoyable evening.

5fXayEYTjrkUeegCdY9pNw.text: A proper British pub - there are still a few remaining! The food was much better than expected and the service was quick, friendly and the food came quickly. Steak burger and sweet potato fries really hit the spot. A great little spot for a casual, cosy lunch.

G15cMuS1r2JLzS2RfvVi5g.text: I enjoyed the Albert while I stayed in London.  Although the service was average (typical pub), it wasn't bad.  And the food was pretty good pub food, large portions, lots of good beers, great atmosphere and good location.  I will certainly go back if and when I am in London again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Alberts Pub - Sept. 2009

TfOa6Lys0bcxwpQQXTZmRw.text: Terrible fish and chips served to tour company guests.  Was told by server that the tour company,  Premium Tours, only pays for the cheap haddock for its guest rather than cod.  It was really garbage and the staff even agreed it was rubbish. Hard,  frozen and awful.  TV dinners are better.  Shame on the tour company but shame shame shame on the Albert for agreeing to this arrangement.  Gives London fish and chips a really bad name.  Avoid!

WSogGRbixxiErKV22b8Jrg.text: great pub. great location. great ambiance. great food - for the price.visiting from san francisco - i ordered a double vodka on ice, a pint of london pilsner, the steak and ale pie and a side salad. all told, 26 pounds - or ~USD$43. (hey - it's london. EVERYTHING'S expensive!). i really liked the steak and ale pie - it had a great crust - and the london pilsner was clean and nutty.i'd definitely recommend this place to my friends and fellow travelers.

9FgFjrEsEpiY9yB9DTz14g.text: Named after Queen Victoria's late husband, The Albert can often appear to be as dead as the man himself.  Strictly speaking its a lunch-time pub which caters to the employee's of the many companies that swarm this particular area including Transport for London in the building next door.It was whilst working for TfL that I first went to the Albert and I was pleasantly surprised by what I found.  Inside is a welcome relief from the great glass and concrete structures that surround the building, with comfy stools and a genuine pub atmosphere.  Food here is excellent: cheap and cheerful English favourites that fill you up without emptying your wallet.  Drinks are a little pricy but thats too be expected from a pub which principally makes its money from businessmen and women.All in all a decent place to go, haven't been on the weekend yet but it doesn't strike me as a great night.  Definitly the place for a chat and a bit of grub.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom

2Pa8cND25YerPF4nQoAWsQ.text: Normally, I'm not giving many points, but after having not been here for ages, I'm very pleased and we've been there a few times lately.The pub is right beautiful and well decorated in the Victorian manner.I found the service really good, polite and effective. Ordering the second time the barman remembered my previous order.Nice choice of beers, including real ales. The St. Patrick's Day special gag-beer was one from Wiltshire that looked bright green. It tasted normal but the colour was revolting.Food was alright but not very good.I was surprised to have liked the atmosphere. There were not too many tourists. Only a hord of Westminster school students really nerved, running in an out all the time.On normal days and times of day a very good pub to go to.Free Wi-Fi.LorraineW seems right about the toilets. We (m+f) found them clean.

ZKrqbbUqZUcdxewTnnyFnw.text: Well I think I will fly in the face of the others who have left reviews. I went to this pub on Remembrance Day 14th November 2010. The interior is indeed a throw back. Partner and me had a lengthy, if boring debate as to, if it was original or refurb? Does it matter I ask myself? Anyhow, on this day they had a band called Rockabellas a nostalgic group of three girls who performed just brilliantly. I am in the catering business and let me tell you this was a rocking class pub day. Beers were fine, upstairs carvery, have to be truthful basic but you know £11 quid something a....what do you expect? Too be frank food was far off what id call fabulous but ya know it was not a fabulous silly high price session either. Atmosphere in the pub was just fabulous, packed for the special occasion (remembrance day) the band were stunning I mean the business!!! (Cannot over emphasise this too much) The staff were in period 1940's costume hair make up....all in all just the business!! Anyhow, all of this flys in the face of previous reviews (Which none the less I respect) but you have to speak how you find. The occasion I was there, one time or what.... "This was a true master class in how to run a pub A stunning day in the pub just about as good as it gets. Simple as that!

ydXlky4_2QfCucsq-4Ac2g.text: After an unsuccessful attempt to dine at their sister pub, the Grafton Arms, we were directed to the Albert Pub on Victoria, and it turned out to be a great experience.  This pub sits on the very busy thoroughfare, Victoria Street.  It's architecture and design were lovely from the outside, and looked pretty good from the inside too. On the exterior, their etched glass windows made it look like a place with character, with inviting and cheerful flowered window boxes. The interior was a blend of older dark brown oak bar meets juke box.  We found a corner in the back, next to the fire place, and wound up being cozily installed in a booth where we could quietly chat and recap the long day we'd had while planning the next one.  We ordered a sampler platter with fish & chips, mincemeat pies, and sliders as well as a full-sized burger.  I had a cider, and we shared a delicious bite and related for an hour. Unlike our original experience at the Grafton, the server immediately greeted us and ushered us to a table. There was no confusion about serving or not serving, or dining or not dining.  All went beautifully with  brisk and efficient service, a nice meal, and a crisp cider.  We were so tired and hungry, it put a nice end to a long day.  We tipped our terrific waiter very generously, and plan on going back.

KgmmBfMs9NOF4KbWkGMg4w.text: Quite a nice pub conveniently located close to St James's Park tube station. The toilets are down a rather narrow staircase but I think they have been refurbished since the previous reviewer visited as they were clean and in good condition.

AgmXYC6MO76D9HSOn_ONnA.text: The Albert's interior is a wonderful homage to the great Vicorian pubs of the past. Ornate furnishings and original gas lighting (updated to include light bulbs) make The Albert a lovely pub to sit in. However, there are too few beers, and those that are present are overpriced. The food appears to be mainly microwaved and this lets the pub down somewhat. The proximity of The Albert to Westminster means that it is a regular tourist stop, somewhat detracting from its cosiness. This, along with the particularly rude bar staff - try getting served without a sneer - make it an uncomfortable experience after a hard day's work. There are better pubs nearby that offer a friendly charm such as the Pheonix or the Cardinal, I'd check those out first before settling in here.

sBRIkVO6X9cvStesi_8wxg.text: Nice hanging baskets outside , looks really nice and traditional. However its just part of a chain with the same sad , sticky , dirty menus and tables as most of the other pubs around there. Stick to wetherspoons, they are better value

NZS3XC6mdsrwYs7IsHpfKg.text: Worst toilets ever!The toilets are at the bottom of a thin staircase, with a door at the top. Makes human traffic very bad and awkward to pass.The toilet sits on a man hole cover, and is in very bad condition.They were also filthy. There was a sanitary towel on the floor!

er44QyRV6fhceH6iyNv1oQ.text: My wife and I went to The Albert for lunch the Christmas season and really loved it.  So much we sent back several times.  The food was good, the mulled wine was good and the service was very good each time we went.  We would certainly recommend The Albert Tavern!

nq1Pb-EuXKPdVgGOfnT2hg.text: We liked this place a lot. Several pubs we looked at seemed to be bars that only cared about serving drinks--not dinner. This one, though, had a separate dining room upstairs. We weren't disappointed. My fish & chips was great, & the portion was huge. Tom liked his rump steak, too. I definitely recommend this place (despite the bland peas & French fries).

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. The rump steak came with baked tomato & mushroom plus salad (or fried or mashed potatoes).
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. The fish was wonderfully crispy on the outside but moist & flavorful on the inside.

8vjJxCiZeD3X7D4kq0dKOg.text: This place gets very crowded in a game night with lots of locals and tourists hang out. Cheap drinks. Nothing to stand out, nothing too offensive, just an average British pubs. Note: the female bathroom is disgusting.

FRhcGxcm8Oq5XZSz27jrBg.text: London solved its notoriously "terrible food" problem by creating another problem.This pub, and many like it in London, are beautiful visual spectacles. Old buildings, incredible atmosphere, lots of history. But many of them also share another common thread - the "Taylor Walker" menu.It's a menu that's replicated in what must be dozens of pubs in London. The food is certainly good, but when you can get it on so many street corners, it renders itself painfully inauthentic, so much so that I'd call it the "London tourist trap of food."Speaking of which, beer. Boddington's, Newcastle... meh. I can get that stuff any day of the week in America. And the downright communist beer pouring rules... how can you get drunk in this town without carrying a flask around?Have a beer or two here... the food by its very nature can be skipped.

AJm5fwkKQTPOTAVR4OQwlg.text: Totally awesome place we found after walking by Big Ben, total old school pub feel with great beers on top. The food is not bad at all and we had one of he best BBQ sauces we have ever tasted. Will post pictures of inside and why we got but for being in a business district his place is its awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Outside
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. TAYLOR WALKER FAVOURITES PLATTER
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Inside

M_7AfvbdpTJ3NKW4kRBVAw.text: Great location. It's cleaner and brighter since it was purchased by a big chain, Taylor  Walker. However, it retains its Victorian charm with large cut glass windows. They have ten cask ales in addition to mass produced watery stuff like Stella. Service is slow and not especially friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom

GiU7WKTND3zsJ3zXpL0eAw.text: I'd give it zero stars if I could because we sat for 30 minutes with no one acknowledging us.  And it wasn't because the pub was hopping.  We watched the bar tenders joking and chatting behind the bar as one occasionally checked in with tables in another section.  We gave up and walked out.

tamK0R8XyiCEqZieE1d0QA.text: Reliable corner pub with football and fish and chips. Stays open later than most places near here. Especially on sundays when everything shuts down. Good for watching the match or sitting outside in the cold and people watching.

tsZ0jtdCMSj-EV3MMrkN_g.text: I have been to this pub a number of times, good value food and obviously a well known and popular pub for tourists, but on the day, I did notice some mice droppings on the seating, (brought it to the attention of the manager). It's an old pub, side doors are open so this is probably usual.Hope this isn't a regular occurrence.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom

DKU7LREgWLFBd9BKbBMErg.text: One of my favorite things about London are it's Pubs!! There really isn't a better place to enjoy a Pim's and Lemonade along with some delicious fish and chips. The Albert didn't disappoint. The fish and chips was yummy. The atmosphere is like something out of a Dicken's novel.

7hPqw0S7o0TFgdk7cK3uuA.text: It's a bit touristy but we enjoyed our visit. The place was packed busy and we got the last table in the pub. Service was friendly and prompt as could be for a busy pub. The beers were great and the fish and chips were everything they should be. Generous portions and great taste. It's pub food not fine dining and that's what we wanted. The atmosphere was fun and energetic.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom

cupXh4-xlPmF0D-hdyy4ew.text: One of the highlights of my trip to London. This place is amazing. The beef and ale pie with mushy peas was to die for. They should call the fish and chips, "whale and chips" because it is huge! The atmosphere was like nothing I've seen before. It was raining heavily outside which made it even more cozy inside with the dim lighting. I felt like I was in a Charles Dickens novel. I know, cliche, I'm American, this is as close as I'll ever get. I was reading this place is part of a chain. I wish the chains in the states looked like this place, gorgeous. The building itself is worth taking a peek at (sneak in to use the bathroom and have a looksy). It's this giant beautiful brick building and every thing inside is wood with this great wallpaper and gold trim everywhere. Check out the curtains and each detail on the walls. If the beef and ale pie wasn't so amazing, I could've sat in this place for hours just taking it in. 5 Stars!

ZZIN9xKq5lhztHCfr07-dg.text: Cosy little pub - perfect for a drink (or more). Really friendly atmosphere and great service - even when there was a footy game on and it was super busy. Downside - the loos are down a steep spiral (well spiral-ish) staircase. But would still go back again.

5F-y9zPh3jchdblIHuQR8w.text: Very bland food won't ever be back and wouldn't take the left overs home to my dog. The wait staff kept offering silly excuses to all tables

IDwfr3vy47l-g1okBQcbzg.text: I stumbled upon the Albert late one night when I was starving and it was the only thing open in the area. After a baked potato, glass of wine, and consumption of the free wi-fi, I fell in love and have been back several times. The ambiance is so cozy and old-pub-y. It doesn't seem like a tourist trap to me, because from what I could tell mostly locals were there whenever I went, and my British coworkers like it too. I've only been in the downstairs, because the upstairs restaurant seems too formal for me and doesn't have a menu I'm interested in.It's true that downstairs they don't provide table service, but from what I've experienced this is fairly common in British pubs. Not such a weird thing.The food is delicious. I was super excited to see a vegetarian fish n chips option (made with halloumi cheese), which I've yet to find anywhere else, and it was yummy - a little too greasy, but still good. And I love the sides, desserts, and wine selection. I plan on going back many more times.

xELqIKy9kdF7iIN7MvVIDw.text: This was pretty much the only restaurant open within a 3 block radius that still served food at 7pm on a Sunday night. The James's Park train stop is definitely a quiet area on the weekends.We came here with 2 babies and it was fun seeing the looks we received as we walked into the pub while everyone was having a good time with a drink. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and it definitely gives you that England spirit.There was a room in the back bottom floor that was empty and quiet. We were able to enjoy our fish and chips (don't be deceived by it only containing one piece, it's basically the whole cod), my husband had the roast beef (super tender) and my brother in law had the beef pie (yummy crust). A few of us had mashed potatoes and mashed peas along with other variations of sizes.The portions are huge. The prices are about 3-4 pounds more than the other similar restaurants serving these dishes, but I don't know about the portioning.My only complaint is that the fish and chips lacked flavor. There was absolutely no seasoning on anything. The peas were actually the most flavorful part of the dish. The batter was tasteless although the texture and crunch were good. This was a bit disappointing for me. The other dishes were good.

JLuY9v88jcB1Fs7hgm4fGA.text: I am not sure if it was just a coincidence that when I walked in there servers were dressed as Christmas elves in the middle of October, but I LOVED it!!! We came back a second time for a drink. One of my favourite spots in all of London!

pjsyUv9VVRpB2sHWZ2RUyw.text: A bit polished for a true English pub, this is a nice, fairly relaxed place to get a pint and food.  Yes, it is a tourist trap, but we were fair game, considering our foray into a "real pub" next to our hotel a few nights before that left us with sour stomachs.  This was much better than that and a comfort given the rather corporate area the building is in.  Another pleasant extra: very nice employees who kept our tap water filled and doled out some friendly advice about directions.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. January 2011

yloyTEaFr2Kk2y4OJiaf3g.text: Great British Pub. Had a nice Sunday meal there and some great beer. Kids enjoyed the fish and chips. Waiter and other patrons all great.

WVKo5f2OSHlB-wG5typAoQ.text: Staff was friendly. Our waitress was from Madrid.   She is a hard worker.  She took great care of us.   First meal in London was very tasty.   We'd go back

dML1U5aV6fHz0ZopQhiNtA.text: You will be glad you added this stop to your London dining experience. Great value. Excellent food. Can accommodate large groups but still enjoyable for a quick pint.

39O06f5HSNVU3HDrEcuQdg.text: I'm not a fan of English pubs but of all the ones I've gone to this week this is the winner.  Very good air conditioning. Good service and very good fish and chips.  I have found the Sampson's malt vinegar to be the best and was surprised to find Heinz brand here.  Otherwise great restaurant

JXshq_KmUBan3nSiTjMIeA.text: Not such a good place as I first thought. I know it's summer but with so many people it took absolutely ages to get served yesterday (a Monday!)It's a great place for after work pints if you can get there early enough though

aa5ki24sGMBRBNzyYj_lWg.text: Cozy decor and vibe.We tried full English breakfast--it's downright ok!

BEgobzk5Nw9SA63LtiaaYg.text: Stopped in here for traditional English pub style lunch. Had a favorites platter which was a traditional appetizers - sliders, fish sticks, wings and fries. All good. This was an order/pay with bartender and food delivered to our table but staff was very attentive to us!

Ce5L_QJHLsZXflRGAlkXdw.text: Cute pub on the corner.  Quaint inside, nicely decorated.  Staff very nice, but not attentive to drinks.  Our order was wrong, but they were very sweet to fix it right away.  We had fish and chips with mushy peas.  The food was fresh and delicious.  There are signs posted regarding pick pockets, and my wallet was stolen from my purse while in my possession at all times.  BE CAREFUL in all places!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom

TQA-u3y8dr_UqtFJl5Wn1g.text: We made the effort to locate The Albert Pub while in London due to overwhelming recommendations from P's father. When he was in London, many years ago, this was his favorite haunt. What we found was the quintessential British pub in every way. All of the wood, brass and leather appointments gave the place a slightly formal but still warm, inviting atmosphere. We were there in late November and they had already decorated for the holidays, which added a nice touch. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and even tolerated our teen kids in tow. We enjoyed a hearty, warm lunch of typical pub fare and a pint before heading back into the cold. It was a brief, but enjoyable stop. Very nice place and we will definitely visit again when in London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. The bar with holiday decorations
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Wine menu
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Outside The Albert

FB5RfdIZ_TA4mWmT5ucm4Q.text: Pimm's is what I'm talking about!!!!!! Yes, we'd love another round! The Albert is a great looking building, although under construction when we visited. The inside of the multi-level restaurant bar is beautiful and very traditional. The wood carved bars are stunning... and full of liquor. Win win! The food was decent.Bathroom is allll the way in the basement. Can't imagine having too many drinks and having to take that maiden voyage.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Gorgeous!
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Sampler
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Pimm's please!!!

slWAtIYiRDJdrWtL1OTJUA.text: Had dinner with 9 others UPSTAIRS in the corner booth.  Upon leaving, we discovered that one of the ladies small black bag with long straps was stolen. Management downstairs viewed video surveillance.  Restaurant was super crowded and the thief used the credit cards & McDonalds and Starbucks 3 blocks away.  As this was our last night in London, the victim & spouse had to stay back to acquire a new passport.  We were all from Hawaii and it was difficult to determine how this happened in FRONT of all 9 of us, but guess thief's hands were quicker and we were enjoying the food and company too much.   We were forewarned throughout our travels in Europe of pick pocking thieves and never thought this would happen in a restaurant of all places.   The girls bag had a long black strap which we assumed was an easy target and situated behind her husband's back and another person against a short wall.     The thief later returned the bag to the victim's hotel with passport + Hawaii State ID in place, but less London pounds of course and went on a shopping/food spree for the evening.  Dinner was good at Albert's.  Think camera's surveillance should have been focused in the area of the exit stair well to seriously watch who's coming and going. A very bad experience for victim and spouse, so be careful and bags and purses can never be left out of sight.

aOkJ8hlPSl7mwrIcC1KGUQ.text: Sat for 10 minutes then went to the bar to order but was told to sit and they would come to me. Sat for 10 more minutes, watched the girl drinking tea behind the bar, tried again and was told to go sit, again. Left. Dreadful service. Bad attitude.

uaO3lYCLq2IqfYv9Xs3wsQ.text: Can you rate below one star? I don't know how to do that. Likely the worst place I've ever eaten. In New York, this place would close after the first month. Awful food, worse (and rude) service. After we endured that, we paid the bill IN FULL AND EVEN WITH A SMALL TIP, and were accosted and grabbed and accused of not paying!!! How long should one wait for an attendant....or whatever you would call the person tending to clients.....to collect the check or even check the service? TERRIBLE PLACE...,,worse than a tourist trap. STAY AWAY!!!! I am a foodie and go to the best restaurants in the world!  This place was a disaster! I was actually physically grabbed on steep stairs without anyone having checked the table! This is a shameful place for London. I hope there is better.And after a very verbal confrontation and my 72 year old husband going back up the stairs to get the bill and the payment which had been left on the table, there was not even an apology! We are in agreement that this was the worst dining experience either of us have had on three continents. Rather than London, visit the US, Paris, Canne,Nice, Broughes, Amsterdam, Jerusalem, Jordan. You'll be treated better and have far better food!We were accused of stealing! I can't believe it. In retrospect, WE were stolen from because of the horrible service and horrible food. PLEASE STAY AWAY!!!!

YO9jOwHLnh6yWYYk3hYrhA.text: This is a quaint and cool spot in Westminster. Walking distance from Doubletree Hilton Westminster. Lovely walk. Grab a table and order at the bar. Good delivered to table with speedy and pleasant service. Mushy peas or garden peas - your choice. "Chips" are incredible. Curry sauce with your chips is a real treat. Fish was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom

e_aYPkNVTvvNFu6kZIwVbg.text: Me and my sister went on a mini euro trip and we decided to come here in London for fish & chips! They were very good and I got the vegan ones (since I don't eat fish) and it was cool for me to eat fish & chips with my sister! My dish was about 10 pounds, and I got a cider (which was great too) for 5 pounds. Great place and great food for an even better price!

-Hcw32292U0IRlOhvHJx3w.text: Traditional English breakfast was good,  service was excellent. Conveniently located near Victoria station.  Recommend.

OJXjW_i3ckpztHB1WcLJlA.text: So loved the sunday roast chicken! Fast service. Good place to eat before heading to Victoria Station for a trip.

1ipeGblGtaViIISkSI6ktQ.text: We ran into this place while walking around London and glad we stopped in. Really cool bar downstairs and calmer bar upstairs. I had a chicken burger with bacon and chips and it was very tasty! Friendly staff and fast service. Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Outside of The Albert
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. Outside of The Albert

S1ph1EmMDLdlWruL4FTCGw.text: The Albert is very deceiving.  From the outside, it looks one-of-kind, but inside, it is very cookie-cutting corporate as it is part of the "Taylor Walker" chain of pubs.My fellow Americans, think of it as TGIFs or Applebees of England.Try elsewhere.

526NoGLckPcnk2mI4Ttisg.text: This is a 'drinking only' pub if ever I saw one. Yes, its a very pretty victorian era pub that serves beer. Thats where the star is earned.The rest, keep it. The food is ridiculously bad. The burger is grey on wilted fixings, chips barely warm, fish not crisp and their veggies 'boil in the bag' quality. The wait service, forgetful.Not a place for more than a pint. When we saw the food, we didn't.

sKSN-LRY57YuT5zSyA3S_g.text: I was blessed to visit London last spring and stay in Westminster. Our first day there we arrived in the evening and decided to take a stroll. We rounded a corner after leaving our hotel and much to our pleasant surprise we stumbled across this adorable building that was The Albert. We decided after the long flight and travel that we wanted to go upstairs to a table and order. What ambiance. This place is now one of the peaceful happy places in my mind that I go to to destress some days. I suppose that is why I'm taking the time to write this review some months later. From the fire blazing in the fire place on that cold night to the candles burning around the room we instantly felt welcomed and warmed.Our servers were super friendly, welcoming us to the country. As to ordering, of course, I ordered the fish and chips what with it being the first meal in London and all. It was the best fish and chips I have ever had and I am now hesitant to ever order it anywhere again. It was gorgeous. Flavorful and just yum. My companions ordered the bangers and mash and the steak and kidney pie. To die for. They also have a Carvery on Sundays. We made this spot our home away from home while we visited, eating there several times, and we got to know the staff a bit. They gave us great pointers and walking paths to take in the sites. The Albert will always hold a special place in my heart. Should I find myself in London again it is definitely on my must do list. It is just off the district line at St James Park station. Do yourself a favor and go.

photos.caption: Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. My fish and chips
Photo of The Albert - London, United Kingdom. The inside of The Albert upstairs

ZGc5KivkeyvwC4y-4zilQA.text: Very large with lots of space. For a weekday it was really busy and took us a while to be served but we had nowhere to go. We were just chilling. Such interesting character that isn't in existence back home. Love the outside window sketches. Prices were fair. Customer service could've been friendlier, however, I understand that he was distracted and it was busy.

etKkAVGAlrOVX3dHyt3yYQ.text: Loved this authentic pub in Victoria.  Beautiful interior and exterior, bringing you back to Victorian times.I do agree that there aren't many beer options, however, I had a couple of pints of a lighter beer that I quite enjoyed. The food is NOT microwaved as someone else here has indicated. The fish and chips were amazing - a GIANT, FRESH piece of battered cod served with crisp fries and green peas. It was perfectly light and crisp. Delicious.  I had a beef and ale pie which was incredibly crisp and buttery on the outside and beefy/saucy on the inside. This was served with mashed potatoes and gravy and fresh mixed vegetables. Our other friend had the roast beef dinner which was like prime rib here in the states served with mashed potatoes, roasted potatoes, mixed vegetables and yorkshire pudding. A LOT of food for the money.Prices EXTREMELY reasonable - fish and chips 13.99GBP, my steak pie $13.99GBP, the roast beef dinner i think was 15.99GBP.The pub is extremely busy and loud (which is part of the atmosphere). Service a bit slow but very friendly. Oh - and bathrooms are down a spiral staircase in the basement (quite a challenge if you've had too much to drink I am sure).Must try if you're looking for a great pub experience while visiting London
